comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SS_Grosser_Kurf%c3%bcrst Spangenberg was her captain in 1913 when she rescued the SS Volturno

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: LOC -- Your title needs emending -- "Grosser," not "Grosse" -- see the inscription on the lifesaving flotation ring.

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: Wystan and Jim Rees: Thanks for pointing out the typos.  We'll fix them next time we update the record.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
The fellow in the center, wearing a business suit, looks like Lionel Carden, the British envoy to Mexico, who in October 1913 (about the time of the Volturno disaster) was expelled by Carranza and recalled to London, for his criticism of U.S. President Woodrow Wilson:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4390173258/]

comment.author: 44573711@N00
comment._content: This NY Time story "TELL OF RESCUES BY THE KURFUERST sounds like the vessel in the photo above. But she sure isn't the BATTLESHIP SMS Großer Kurfürst, but rather is the passenger liner here.
